intro: Isopogon formosus var. dasylepis, commonly known as the pink bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its dense, cylindrical inflorescences that are typically pink to red in color. The plant belongs to the family Proteaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in coastal regions. The leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its aesthetic appeal throughout the year.
